item.title: National Heritage Area Authorization Act of 2017

latestAction.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 155.

item.title: Mountains to Sound Greenway National Heritage Act

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

item.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 478.
Introduced in the Senate. Read the first time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Read the First Time.

summary.text:
Mountains to Sound Greenway National Heritage Area Act

This bill establishes the Mountains to Sound Greenway National Heritage Area in the state of Washington.

The Mountains to Sound Greenway Trust is designated as the local coordinating entity for the heritage area, which shall prepare and submit a management plan for it.

bill.title: Mountains to Sound Greenway National Heritage Area Act

item.title: Mountains to Sound Greenway National Heritage Area Act
Mountains to Sound Greenway National Heritage Area Act
A bill to establish the Mountains to Sound Greenway National Heritage Area in the State of Washington.

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 478.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
